DataElement.preferredName: California Verbal Learning Test - Second Edition Free Recall Trials 1-5 T Score Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric representation of the Total T score for Free Recall subtest Trials 1-5 in the California Verbal Learning Test - Second Edition.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: California Verbal Learning Test - Second Edition Free Recall Trials 1-5 T-Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The second version of California Verbal Learning Test, a neuropsychological test developed to make a comprehensive and detailed assessment of verbal learning and memory in individuals ranging in age from 16 to 89 years._The first part of the California Verbal Learning Test, second edition. For the first five trials, a 15-item list, List A, is read to the subject and he or she is asked to recall words from the list after each presentation._A method for converting an individual score into a standard form. While similar to a z-score, t-score is used when the conversion is made without knowledge of the population standard deviation and mean.

ObjectClass.preferredName: California Verbal Learning Test - Second Edition
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The second version of California Verbal Learning Test, a neuropsychological test developed to make a comprehensive and detailed assessment of verbal learning and memory in individuals ranging in age from 16 to 89 years.

Concepts.longName: California Verbal Learning Test - Second Edition

Property.preferredDefinition: The first part of the California Verbal Learning Test, second edition. For the first five trials, a 15-item list, List A, is read to the subject and he or she is asked to recall words from the list after each presentation.:A method for converting an individual score into a standard form. While similar to a z-score, t-score is used when the conversion is made without knowledge of the population standard deviation and mean.

Concepts.definition: The first part of the California Verbal Learning Test, second edition. For the first five trials, a 15-item list, List A, is read to the subject and he or she is asked to recall words from the list after each presentation.

A method for converting an individual score into a standard form. While similar to a z-score, t-score is used when the conversion is made without knowledge of the population standard deviation and mean.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity that represents the conversion of an individual score into a standard form made without knowledge of the population standard deviation and mean.
